section: Section 1: Living Organisms and the Environment
objective: Understand the place of humans in the biological world.
content: Characteristics of living things, cell structure, and the impact of humans on the ecosystem.
specific_objectives: Describe the characteristics of living organisms (MRSGREN)
Compare plant and animal cells in the context of human biology
Identify the various types of microbes (bacteria, viruses, fungi)
Explain the importance of food chains and food webs for human survival
Discuss the human impact on the environment (pollution, deforestation)

objective: Analyze the functioning of major human organ systems.
content: Nutrition, respiration, circulation, and excretion. Focuses on maintaining homeostasis.
specific_objectives: Discuss human nutritional requirements and balanced diets
Identify the parts and functions of the digestive, respiratory, and circulatory systems
Explain how the body disposes of metabolic waste (excretion)
Describe the mechanisms of movement and support (skeleton and muscles)
Understand the role of the nervous and endocrine systems in coordination and control

objective: Understand the biological basis of reproduction and inheritance in humans.
content: Human reproduction, birth control, and basic genetic inheritance.
specific_objectives: Identify the parts of the human male and female reproductive systems
Describe the process of fertilization and development of the fetus
Evaluate various methods of family planning and birth control
Explain simple genetic inheritance and the causes of variation
Discuss chromosomal abnormalities (e.g., Down syndrome)

section: Section 4: Disease and Its Impact on Humans
objective: Analyze the causes, transmission, and prevention of diseases.
content: Infectious vs non-infectious diseases, the immune system, and lifestyle diseases.
specific_objectives: Distinguish between communicable and non-communicable diseases
Identify causes and symptoms of common diseases (Asthma, Diabetes, Malaria, AIDS)
Explain the body's defense mechanisms (skin, white blood cells, antibodies)
Discuss the importance of vaccines and antibiotics
Analyze the impact of drug abuse (alcohol, cigarettes) on human health

section: Section 5: The Impact of Health Practices on the Environment
objective: Evaluate the role of community health practices in maintaining a safe environment.
content: Water purification, sewage treatment, and refuse disposal.
specific_objectives: Describe methods of large-scale and small-scale water purification
Explain the importance of proper sewage and refuse disposal
Identify the lifecycle of common vectors (housefly, mosquito) and methods of control
Discuss the importance of personal hygiene and food safety
